page.title: 13HOUSING.
page.content: {OWSTON CONSERVATION VILLAGE { ___________________________ Owston is a conservation village and there is no permission for any new houses. Existing buildings are subject to planning restrictions from the local authority for any extensions. The Priory, adjacent to the church, is on Norman foundations and might have been the monastery hospital. It has a sundial dated{1319}and two fifteenth century doorways, but was mainly rebuilt in the seventeenth century. Stone from the abbey is evident in the village and there are several listed buildings including one Georgain house and one house has its windows blocked as a result of window tax. There are only three post-war houses, two of which are council owned, Otherwise everyone owns their own home. All old cottages are now modernised.
